Title: Relates to providing for rest between work shifts
Summary: Relates to providing for rest between work shifts; prohibits the scheduling of an employee to work the first ten hours following the end of the previous calendar day's work shift or on-call shift or the first ten hours following the end of a work shift or on-call shift that spanned two calendar days unless an employee consents or volunteers, in which case the employee shall be paid one and one-half times the regular rate of pay.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation to providing for rest between work shifts
